main event: On January 22, 1951, two pilots observed a metallic object near a tracking balloon during a flight near Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object appeared to maintain a relative position to the balloon for about 10 minutes., The balloon broke off and continued to rise while the object moved at a high speed., Holloman Radar confirmed they had no other aircraft in the area at the time., The pilots described the object as round, silvery, and emitting a bright light., The object disappeared from sight after flashing brightly.
location: 50 mi SE of Holloman AFB, New Mexico, USA
witness description: Two pilots participating in a project at Holloman AFB
